meanings.definition: to add more fuel to a fire or flame
meanings.sent1: Dad restokes the campfire to keep us warm at night.
meanings.sent2: She carefully restokes the fireplace to make sure it doesn't go out.
meanings.sent3: The firefighter restokes the bonfire, accidentally setting his own boot on fire.
meanings.sent4: The chef restokes the grill, creating a sizzling inferno of deliciousness.
meanings.sent5: The hiker quickly restokes the dwindling fire, sending sparks dancing into the night sky.

meanings.definition: the act of reigniting a fire or flame
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the forest needed a restokes to come back to life.
meanings.sent2: The restokes of the candle brought light back into the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a sudden restokes of the torch, revealing a hidden door.
meanings.sent4: The restokes of passion in their relationship made everything feel new and exciting again.
meanings.sent5: The restokes of the bonfire illuminated the faces of the campers, casting flickering shadows around them.
